Hard Rock Hotel Penang
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4903 reviews

We love Hard Rock because of its rocky style and standard. Visiting HR will always in our travel itinerary wherever we go and we just came back from HR Gold Coast.

Unfortunately, our stay in Lagoon Deluxe Room (corner unit) was unexpected and disappointed. The reason we chose Lagoon was because of the deck that allows us to swim down to the swimming pool and enjoy our drinks but: First, sunbeds got insect or bird shit stain (not hygiene and dirty), then the floor was not sweep. Second, when using toilet the basin water tap was not in a good condition as need to adjust when using and it leak. On the next day, we found that the bed sheet was "torn out" and the ceiling light near the mini bar was out and on that night there are flies flying around us when we are having our refreshments and residents above us threw the cigarette box plastic cover down from balcony. (HR may need to reconsider covering up the ground floor residents - roof above deck) Upon checking out, Chine (HR-frontdesk) was kind enough to ask us how was our stay and I did highlight to him so he can send the maintenance guy to rectify the matters before the next resident. Anyway, please send my appreciation to Fatihah (HR-Reservation) for arranging the birthday cake to my girlfriend. Cheers/ Room 136

Show more
Jean , Malaysia
Hotel Jen Penang By Shangri-La
8 Very good
Based on 4052 reviews

Hotel Jen is currently undergoing renovation works and construction work is from 9am - 6pm, and I think it will be till July.

If you are out during the day, then the noise from construction won't be a problem. I was given a newly refurbished hotel room, but not the king-sized bed I had requested for. Instead they gave me a 2-single-beds twin room, separating husband and wife in sleep *sigh* Toilet bowl is positioned too high, so when seated, your blood flow to the legs gets cut off. Have already written to the management about the problem and suggested solutions, and let's see if they make any improvements to their refurbishments. I will be returning in September and will take note. Other than that, the beds were clean and comfortable, decor has been modernized and given a fresh look. Staff were polite, friendly and efficient, and the hotel location is most excellent - near to both shopping malls and numerous good hawker food within 10 minutes' walk.

Show more
Francin , Singapore
G Hotel Gurney
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3401 reviews

Stayed 2 nights on Club/Executive Floor. Spacious, comfortable room with large TV screen and very good selection of channels.

Huge bathroom - with bath - and excellent shower, with plenty room for you, but a tiny shelf for your 'bits'. Check-in staff should relax a little and remember the guest is more important than the 'system'. To be asked on checking in what time - not just date confirmation - you will be leaving is not very welcoming, though may be helpful for Housekeeping. Location is perfect, on Gurney Drive, for easy shopping and taxis. Will definitely stay again.

Show more
Justine , United Kingdom
Eastern And Oriental Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 2605 reviews

Location is Great. Walking distance to Most Heritage places that we would like to go. Room was superb with an amazing view of the sea from our room balcony.

But the best part of the room would be the bathroom! It comes with a separate shower room and a bathtub. There are 2 options that we can choose for Breakfast. We can dine in either at the Planters Lounge facing the pool or the Andaman sea. Or having your International and Local Buffer at Sarkies. Staff are very friendly. Special mention to staff name, Zira, at the Reception counter, who was pleasantly sweet and she took an effort to explain to us the fastest routes and recommendations for places of interest in Georgetown. Not forgetting staff at the Planters Lounge (didnt manage to take down the name of the male staff) who took great care of us during our stay. Overall, thumbs up for this hotel and you will not regret choosing it as your Accommodation.

Show more
Sivanathan , Singapore
PARKROYAL Penang Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 3389 reviews

Checked in on 29th n check out on 31st October 2016. Arrived at 2.45pm..ask to wait ..served drinks..

waited till 3.30pm..nothing happened..my wife asked the reception,they ask to wait...then 3.45pm they give me the key card..went 3rd floor..surprisingly the ŕoom was not ready..we waited 5 minutes with my 5year old kid n my 60 years old mom..they were rushing to clean the room..(i was thinking is ths really 5 star rated).Then we went in n the floor was still dirty with sand n dust,maybe they were rushing n forgot to clean the floor. Then next day their breakfast was good..plenty of choices n good service. Then the best drama was on the second night..suddenly around 12am. ..BLACKOUT.. not even a single emergency light inside the room..so i ran out to check the corridor..and wow!!! There is no single emergency light at the corridor too..we have to on our laptop to lit up the room. Pleaselah call urself 5 star n u dont even provide emergency lights to ur customers...and the best part is it was blackout for nearly 1 hour and hotel phone is electoric phone n u cant call out the reception to ask wat have happened..and the next day when checking out..i was really hoping for an appology from the front desk regarding ths incident but they just maintained as nothing has ever happen..wow..i really not a critic but i paid rm1500 for the 2 nights to sit in blackout??? Damn..anyway thats my experience..hotel location is good..pool is good..thats all.. Stayed October 2016, travelled with family

Show more
thavasegaran , Malaysia
The Wembley - A St Giles Hotel Penang
8.4 Excellent
Based on 2432 reviews

1st time stay at this hotel and personally, I would not choose this hotel again for my future trip to Penang.

Upon reaching the hotel, no warm welcome by the concierge nor the reception personnel... Well, it did not really bother us much... Afterall, not all hotelier knows their basic rules. The check in process was taken awhile despite our booking was prepaid and we were told that the occupancy was less than 50%. Hence, the slow motion was really unacceptable. Upon entering to the room, we were assigned to a smoking floor with strong cigarette smell's room. Having travelled with 1 young kid and an infant, we could not tolerate the smell and immediately called the Front Office for a room changed. We were asked to wait in the room while they would search for another room for us. We waited for about 10-15 mins in the room and we could not stand the bad smell anymore so we went down to the lobby. To our surprise, we were told that no more rooms could be changed. What! I told the receptionist said the occupancy was less than 50%. After some argument and insisted to see the FOM, finally they had room for change. There were some defeats in

Show more
Binxuan , Malaysia
Lexis Suites Penang
7.9 Very good
Based on 1898 reviews

Staying here for 2 nights. The room is spacious and nice as usual similar to other Lexis hotel. The interior design is also the same.

High-rise type of room gives this particular hotel more privacy to us in pool. However, the pool and the surrounding is not very clean (got some tissue in the balcony just above the pool, and the pool got some debris). those who does not familiar with Penang area, do not expect anything around the hotel area. it was isolated and far from many attaction in penang (except for Mee Udang in Jalan Gertak Sanggul). Plus, the main roads is still under constuction where you have to make a detour to go outside of the place (I am well aware of the situation since i am very familiar with Penang) The beach? nah... it was meant for the fishermen. Not very suitable for people to hang out and bathing. The bed is very big (2 king sized bed), it was very comfortable for us with 2 children. There are not many channel provided for the TV. Only regular channel and no movie channel. The TV was mounted on the wall inside a glass. You cannot access to the HDMI port or USB port if you wants to watch movies of your own. Overall it was good experience and still value for money.

Show more
MOHD , Malaysia
Evergreen Laurel Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 6385 reviews

I booked for 2 nights via Agoda. I needed to extend my stay for another night. I went to the reception but it was just a hassle as they 1.

Offered me their standard rate which was too expensive. then the supervisor suggested that 2. I scan a QR code to enjoy a special rate. And finally, after I complaint that it was a hassle to download the app and scan the code 3. Offered me the 'managers' rate which way above the Agoda rate. I was disappointed and checked into another better hotel at a better rate than Agoda. My suggestion to the front desk. You should have responded as such "Absolutely sir, we can extend your stay at the same rate you paid Agoda" . I am sure the hotel GM will be able to approve the rate. Now not only have you lost one night but my business forever. Customer service is not only to be able to have that friendly and courteous service but how to handle exceptions. It was a great opportunity to delight me, but you messed it up big time hiding behind your policies.

Show more
Sekar , Malaysia
G Hotel Kelawai
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1097 reviews

This is my first trip visiting Penang with my 2year old toddler. I decided to book G Hotel Kelawai due to the good reviews.

it would have been an excellent stay if not for the horrible taxi ride back to the International Airport this morn from the hotel. Let me start with the 'Very Good'. The hotel is new, clean and modern. Nice big room with a good sized cot for my toddler. Water is replenished twice a day and there is complementary mini bar. The staff is friendly and prompt, and even if they are not sure of anything, they will check and get back to you. Hotel is located between 2 big Malls, and near all the local food. I will return to this hotel again... However, this morning at 720am, we got the taxi from the hotel to the Airport. I was surprised that it was RM50 as taxi from Airport to hotel is only RM44.70 and normally taxis from hotels back to airport are cheaper than airport to hotel due to all the surcharges. The taxi driver sensed my displeasure and he showed me the charge card from G Hotel to Aiport that it is a flat rate of RM50. When I checked with the hotel staff, they assured me it is indeed RM50. What happened next was horrifying....initially the driver Switched on the taxi metre and covered it with his cap....then he went by a HUGE detour and took 50minutes to reach the Airport!!! When he reached the airport, his metre indicated RM62 and happily collected RM50 from us. He went a big round JUST TO JUSTIFY IT'S WORTH RM50!!!!! He probably drove 50km instead of 23km from hotel to airport. And there was no jam as it was still early in the morning. My biggest regret was not getting a cab through Grab or Uber. For those reading this, do note that the taxi Drivers are 'in cahoots' with the hotel. You may want to get your cab elsewhere. For the GM from G Hotel reading this, please let that taxi driver know that I know he took a Long Route to the airport and it was a very dishonest way of doing things, and I didn't retaliate because I have a young chil

Show more
Emily , Singapore
The Light Hotel Penang
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1573 reviews

Warm welcome at check in. Lovely clean quiet room with block out curtains and comfortable bed with excellent pillows.

Free snacks and drinks. Morning paper each day. Small pool and good gym if you want. Wifi was fast and no problems experienced. Great breakfast with Western style and local-largely Indian-dishes. Service was good and very efficient. Hotel is a short bus ride [2RM] to the ferry across to Georgetown or you can catch a hotel car there for 28RM. Ferry is fun and 1.25RM each RETURN. Shops across the road including a Parkson's department store and good variety of food shops. LA Espresso did a good latte in a nearby street. The Bird Park is walking distance or a bus stop or two away but we didn't go. For the money this was excellent value. Georgetown was reached in about 30-40 minutes by car and ferry but coming back by ferry and bus took longer as we had to wait for the bus.

Show more
DUNCAN , Australia
Cititel Hotel Penang
7.7 Very good
Based on 6476 reviews

If you're planning to go for the famous nasi kandar and chowrasta market.. this is the place to stay.

The rooms are OK but tad small for standard room. The pool is not interesting for the kids. Bit far from city centre and gurney driver. However service and hospitality is 5star although hotel is a bit rundown and elderly staffs. Will still recommend to friends though..

Show more
Marini , Malaysia
Olive Tree Hotel Penang
8 Very good
Based on 1208 reviews

Pros? its quite new,but,two years old facilities without proper management can be quite bad...This id the second time in this hotel,first time the wall is wet due to aircond failure,changed a room and was ok,check out the second day,thought its just a small issue,second stay,i bought in a group of friends of about 30 pax checking in individual staying for 6 nights,problem with aircond again,got down grade to a smaller room,was too tired to argue to the asistance front desk manager,(manager with the highest rank in the hotel,no one else),just a simple appology,second day i move to suite,then,wifi dont work for i phone user, aircond need a long time to work,corridor is like a oven, again just a appology, third day,treated badly by a young bar tender and duty manager due to cockage charges after the lobby lounge is close.

.had a bad arguement till f&b manager came and appologise to us,overall stay is also unpleasant due to other problem with the other front desk..

Show more
Boon , Malaysia
Sunway Hotel Georgetown
7.7 Very good
Based on 7443 reviews

It's a very good location because near to all good foods. They upgrade me to the family room due to the room I have booked fully book.

To me nothing different but I appreciate to the upgraded. The breakfast also full of people in the morning, so we have no place to sit. They also upgrade us to the breakfast in the 14th floor. Breakfast still ok, but not much choices, this should be improve. Chinese staff attitude very friendly when I check in, but the indian staff when I check out should be go for training again because don't know what is customer service even simple smile also don't know and ask a few questions also cannot!!! Overall still ok. looking forward for the improvement in future.

Show more
Irene , Malaysia
Flamingo Hotel by the Beach
7.1 Very good
Based on 6189 reviews

The Hotel did not warn the residents before the booking that there will be a power cut. We received a notification the night before it happened.

We were on the 12th floor and the power went out for everything including the common area that was not part of the notification. We were told in the memo that the common area will be powered by generators. However, this was not the case and had to find our way down ourselves as the staff did not show us which staircase to use etc. When we queried and asked, they refused to answer and pretended they do not understand English. During breakfast, we sat outside the first day, and all these crows started attacking the food the minute we sat down. The staff did nothing and just watched from the side with amusement. Barely any attempts to try and make the breakfast area pleasant and hygienic. Other hotels have monkeys and baboons and they are still able to make sure it is safe and pleasant for the visitors. Flamingo team doesn't seem to care. The bed was very old, we were told it was a king bed only to be given a twin bed, and the blankets was not even 5 feet long, so we couldn't cover ourselves fully.

Show more
Maslina , Malaysia
Lone Pine Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 2306 reviews

The hotel's property has character and is quite historical in a way. It was very well renovated but through the years you can spot the wear and tear on the furniture in the room.

Wooden chairs and cabinets look like they could do with a nice coating to bring back the shine. The white canopy looked dirty and moldy in the dining area. Friendliness - Hardly at the reception area. Upon check-in, a receptionist helped out well. However, the one who brought us the Welcome Drink and Cold Towel (nice gesture and standard from the hotel), was totally grumpy and unfriendly. No Hello or Welcome to Lone Pine, etc. No cold towel for my niece. The person just flopped the glass right in front of me. And walked away! The next night, we came back to the hotel about 10.30pm. All quiet. Two people were seated, staring onto their computers. Instead of them greeting us, we greeted them. And the Hellos were superficial and reluctant! How sad! House Keeping - not happy to give extra amenities. Some of us have long, thick hair and need extra shampoos. We did not receive any replenishment of canned drinks, which are on complimentary basis from the hotel, on the second day. Made a call and was told someone will bring them. No one came. Had to report to the Receptionist. And there were results. We did not patronize the tour service but definitely we would not want to deal from that representative. Not approachable/friendly either. Overall Impression at the Front Office - COLD AMBIENCE & UNINVITING. Plus points on great service goes to the F&B team at the dining restaurant & Lounge. They greeted people, very helpful and approach us all with professionalism. My family and I felt at least "Welcomed" by this team. Plus points to the overall room set-up. Spacious! Love that!

Show more
Lay , Malaysia
Cititel Express Penang Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 2024 reviews

Read some reviews prior to booking and quite accurate: first impression is how small the room is. Mostly due to narrow gap between the foot of the bed and the wall which has the tv/shelve/mirror.

Lack of toothbrush and hotel slippers also majorly impacted my experience. These are only little things but did not realize how big the inconvenience & discomfort was. I've gotten used to stays that provide this, I don't pack my own toothbrush (who want to repack a wet toothbrush :-p). And who wants to walk barefoot on cold tiles vs wearing your own shoes in the room? I want neither. Fortunately room is clean :-D and staff are friendly & helpful. Free parking inside the hotel is a plus as availability of street parking is inconsistent & required to pay too on weekday daytime. Mall across the road.

Show more
EI , Malaysia
Hotel Neo Plus Penang
7.8 Very good
Based on 2268 reviews

We were staying in Penang for 4 nights and booked 2 different hotels as there were some issues. We stayed in Hotel Neo Plus Penang for the first 2 nights and were very reluctant to change to the next hotel.

True enough, Neo Plus was way better than our second hotel in many areas like location, room size, and cleanliness, breakfast spread and facilities. Firstly, the location is excellent and is within walking distance to many attractions like Jalan Magazine, Jalan Armenian and best of all, it is very near (less than 10 mins walk) to the best Nasi Kandar stall in Georgetown, Deen Maju! Even when you use Grab or Uber, it will take you less than RM10 to reach Fort Cornwallis (depending on demand). Secondly, we got the family room that can accommodate the 3 of us, and it was spacious. The room looks spanking new and the toilet was clean and comfortable. From our room window, we could also see Komtar, the tallest building in Penang clearly and that was quite a sight to marvel at, especially at night. Thirdly, the breakfast spread was decent but tasted great. It will sure be able to satisfy your morning hunger and keep you energized for the later walk around Georgetown. The menu also changes during the two days we stayed at the hotel. Very simple fare like rice, noodles, sausage, chicken, salad spread, bread and buns, fruits, porridge, cereals and some others. They also have an egg station where you can order any type of egg you desire. Decent, simple but filling. Lastly, the swimming pool on the top floor can be considered small but the view was stunning. Be careful of the rough edges around the pool as it is rather sharp and not fitted properly. The management can perhaps install a drinks and snacks bar on top to make the place livelier. Other small mentions include the mini mart that is located in the hotel lobby, great for buying drinks and snacks. There is also a cafe at the ground floor and we received 1 complimentary drink each. The drink wasn't great but

Show more
ALI , Singapore
Kimberley Hotel Georgetown
7.9 Very good
Based on 1040 reviews

Check in was just annoying, 2 weeks before arriving I emailed the provided email from confirmation /website about amount needed for deposit since the booking site mentioned most Malaysia hotels require it.

..no response. I arrived young staff kept overlooking me in line going to next people even though I kept politely saying hey I was next. Finally the male agent goes I am sorry I thought you with the others in line. Then there was a 50 rm deposit for checkin, good thing I just decided to have it anyway despite no response to my email. So check in sucked, room was a back room (301) the window has the at units near it and it's back up to a loading zone just insanely nosey at random times. Housekeeping had little stickers saying everything was sanitary, lies. Hair was everywhere on bathroom floor, sink, mini-fridge and even bed linens. The sink even had dirt in it when I checked in. The Bathroom was just disgustingly overlooked. Calcium/rust/ on windows and walls. I let housekeeping know which did nothing they just came moved the dirt around. I was grossed out whole stay. Front desk is disconnected, one shift tells you breakfast across the street at restaurant, who said we're closed. Then another set tell you upstairs since there's a huge group. The breakfast wasn't worth getting up for, burnt chicken pieces, dry rice and watered down rice. Do not pay extra for the breakfast it's not as advertised on website. It was in walking distance to the Prangrin mall and shops, a few other restaurants and street food thankfully. As usual, we have had a wonderful stay at Rainbow Paradise Beach Resort. I am most appreciative that the staff try their best to give me the same room I've stayed in, although this time, I was given another room just opposite from the room I stayed in before, and I enjoyed this room just as much.

The room on the 21st level is as usual, large and spacious and the furniture is pretty dated, BUT everything works. LOVE the balcony where we have our tea and enjoy not only the cool sea-breeze but also the lovely scenery. The swimming pool is what makes us come back time and again to Rainbow Paradise - it has a super waterfall that pours into a shallow pool so I can sit under there to meditate, and let the waterfall give me a jolly good head and shoulder massage! The pool is surrounded by lovely greenery and it is charming to find pink and white Frangipani flowers that have fallen from the trees and floating serenely in the pool. Buffet breakfast is provided and while the variety isn't big, still, it is adequate, with the usual freshly fried eggs done any style you like, breads and other pastries, local nasi lemak (coconut rice) with the usual condiments (the sambal ikan bilis is quite tasty!) and, depending on the day, pancakes, waffles or bread pudding, roti canai (or prata, Indian fried pancake,depending on the region you come from!), yoghurt and cut fruit. There are many restaurants and eateries just across the road from the hotel, and even a hawker centre with a stall that sells a pretty decent chicken rice and a stall selling soybean drink and beancurd. There is even a massage place that has reasonable prices, just next to the 7-eleven, at the further end of the row of shophouses opposite the hawker centre. Rainbow Paradise is a really good place to chill out and have a relaxing holiday. And I am SO looking forward to the next visit in September 2017!

i decided to revisit penang after reading tan twan eng’s the gift of rain, a man booker prize nominee.

it left me enthralled by its vivid descriptions of penang, historical, charming and a mix bag of identities. to evoke the right senses, i knew my accomodation had to be a place with a past, with a history. clove hall was the absolute choice and the crowning jewel of this personal retreat. located in a quiet neighbourhood, yet conveniently accessible to most sights in unesco heritage georgetown, clove hall is a charming black & white colonial bungalow with 6 exclusive suites. mine was saffron suite, on the right wing of 2nd floor, overlooking the jade-green lap pool. eveything was almost what i imagined, the 4-poster bed with its crisp white sheets, the mosaic tiles, the teak furniture and the frangipani trees. guests will return in the evening after a day of sight seeing to wind down in the lobby which by then is basking in a soft orange glow from the antique lamps. chatting softly among themselves or enjoying a good read over wine or tea before retiring to their suites. in the mornings, one can enjoy a solitary swim before being served breakfast. over my 3 days in clove hall, i spent several hours reading and writing and i was largely left alone. i appreciate the staff respect for guest privacy while ensuring comfort with the right level of attention. clove hall is lovingly run by couple-owners jo and jim lim, who from my observations love what they do. if you are an animal lover, then expect to fall under the charms of geroge, the resident black miniature poodle. i recommend clove hall to anyone seeking a sanctuary with a sense of history and good taste.

A standing mirror that also functions as clothes hanging rack was provided. The cons of the room were: 1) Very thin walls, 2) lounge area that all the double rooms face. As the bathrooms are located nearby the room, you'd hear almost every guest walking by and conversing near the lounge area in front of your room especially with the incredibly thin walls. Likewise, they can hear you converse from within the room unless you speak in a low voice at all times. As for the second con, which regards the lounge area; whenever you go in and out of your room, guests relaxing at the small lounge area would have a clear view of your room and everything in it. Traveler impressions of Penang

when all the large shopping malls, including the large new glitzy ones can begin to put toilet paper in the toilets the comfort of all tourists would increase dramatically.

Thus, I would not recommend Malaysia in general to people with young children when toilet cubicles in shopping centres and large eateries are awash in 12mm of water unless you plan to spend all your time in 5* hotel environment.

Show more
alford ,Australia

It's an old town they use as a tourist trap. Shops touting junk everywhere, and the heat is breathtaking.

A man in our hotel went to hospital for heat stroke and breathing trouble. During the day when we were on rooftop we could see the mountain but it was in a white haze, and the burning season in Indonesia had not even started. Shortly after we arrived, my own wheezing began and had to see a dr twice. It rained and that turned the town into a steamy jungle. The taxi drivers are the WORST. Never use a meter and rip you off on prices. The Rapid bus is a joke, should be called the Snail bus. Food wasn't any different from Kuala Lumpur, everything is fat fried, good to clog your arteries. I wish they had a rapid transit train like KL, but you either rent a bike, or walk, or get gouged by taxi. Everyone bragged on how great this place was, but in the end it was a burned out tourist trap just ripping you off from breakfast to bed. Nothing for kids to do, so they get grumpy and tag along with parents. It was nice that you could walk, but sidewalks are crammed with beggars and parked motorbikes, so you end up on street with crazy drivers. The roads are black macadam, not concrete so they absorb heat and it makes the heat index about 10 degrees higher than ambient temp. This place is "ok" for backpackers who want to drink a lot, but unless you are into seeing a few old buildings, its Uneventful. I was glad to leave.

More about Penang

From its humble beginnings as a trading port, the city of Penang has evolved over the last two centuries into a tourist destination prized for its beaches, historic architecture, affordable accommodation and amazing food. Accommodation spans quaint hotels and inns in historic neighborhoods and luxury beach resorts. The latter are more popular, as most tourists prefer to venture into the colonial enclaves by day, returning to the beaches and resort restaurants and clubs before nightfall.

Penang's capital city, Georgetown, was awarded UNESCO World Heritage status for its fantastic historic neighborhoods. Highlights include Cheong Fatt Tze Mansion and its boutique accommodation, Fort Cornwallis, and the Old City Hall. The hotels in Georgetown are well located for visiting temples and museums.

The newest and most extensive beach resorts are at Batu Ferringhi. It sits on the northern rim of the island and features an enviable spread of seafood restaurants and boutiques along the beach. So many Penang hotels are found here that competition drives down prices, especially in the off-season.

Penang International Airport is one of the best in Malaysia, and it operates flights to major cities across Southeast Asia and the South Pacific. Peak season begins right before Christmas and continues through Chinese New Year, which usually falls in late January or early February. Hotels in Penang charge the highest rates at this time, with the best deals are offered to early bookers.

Be sure to check out the interactive map of Penang for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.

Show more Wong ,Malaysia Discover the neighborhoods of Penang Georgetown 581 hotels Batu Ferringhi 265 hotels Gurney Drive 140 hotels Tanjung Tokong 137 hotels Bayan Lepas 136 hotels Gelugor 106 hotels Tanjung Bungah 62 hotels Bukit Mertajam 58 hotels Bayan Baru 50 hotels Butterworth 32 hotels Air Itam 30 hotels Seberang Perai 25 hotels Balik Pulau 21 hotels Teluk Bahang 15 hotels Seberang Jaya 10 hotels Kepala Batas 8 hotels Batu Maung 6 hotels Sungai Jawi 4 hotels Penang Hill 4 hotels Pulau Jerejak 2 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Penang 604 Guest Houses in Penang 158 Hostels in Penang 33 Serviced Apartments in Penang 28 Resorts in Penang 13 Motels in Penang 8 Capsule Hotels in Penang 1 More about Penang From its humble beginnings as a trading port, the city of Penang has evolved over the last two centuries into a tourist destination prized for its beaches, historic architecture, affordable accommodation and amazing food. Accommodation spans quaint hotels and inns in historic neighborhoods and luxury beach resorts. The latter are more popular, as most tourists prefer to venture into the colonial enclaves by day, returning to the beaches and resort restaurants and clubs before nightfall. Penang's capital city, Georgetown , was awarded UNESCO World Heritage status for its fantastic historic neighborhoods. Highlights include Cheong Fatt Tze Mansion and its boutique accommodation, Fort Cornwallis, and the Old City Hall. The hotels in Georgetown are well located for visiting temples and museums. The newest and most extensive beach resorts are at Batu Ferringhi . It sits on the northern rim of the island and features an enviable spread of seafood restaurants and boutiques along the beach. So many Penang hotels are found here that competition drives down prices, especially in the off-season. Penang International Airport is one of the best in Malaysia, and it operates flights to major cities across Southeast Asia and the South Pacific. Peak season begins right before Christmas and continues through Chinese New Year, which usually falls in late January or early February. Hotels in Penang charge the highest rates at this time, with the best deals are offered to early bookers. Be sure to check out the interactive map of Penang for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.
